SENT.plain: Painless aortic dissection with only focal neurological symptoms and signs can be a great challenge to the emergency physician
Inadvertently and erroneous treatment of stroke may threaten patient's life
We present a patient with painless aortic dissection (DeBakey I), which was initially misdiagnosed as brainstem stroke with catastrophic anticoagulant use
Finally, the patient died of multiorgan failure after surgical intervention
